result.execSummary:
The defendant Jimmie L Bounds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: *Credit for 3 days time served. Huber to apply for work, child care, and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all mandatory surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*Due to financial hardship, Court waived all non-mandatory costs.
*Provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable costs associated.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment- at least 40 hours per week.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim, unless the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*Establish paternity for all children within one week.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
*Time is stayed pending review on 11/06/15 a 1:30 p.m.
***11-06-15/ Judge Rebecca Dallet***
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 2 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.
*2/26/2016 Stay lifted at to eight (8) days.  Straight time, forthwith.  Commitment for Condition time signed/filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmie L Bounds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jimmie L Bounds in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 8 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. No further review needed.
Reflects 11-06-15 Court order imposing 2 days of condition time

Defendant Jimmie L Bounds in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 2 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered the use of a dangerous weapon enhancer as to count 1 dismissed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Shanice M.   Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
Defendant sentenced to serve 40 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served. Huber privileges to apply for work, child care, and treatment  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, unless the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all mandatory surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all non-mandatory costs.
-Obtain and maintain full-time employment- at least 40 hours per week.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Establish paternity for all children within one week.
-Provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable costs associated.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Jimmie L Bounds in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a jury trial.
AS TO COUNT 1 (amended):
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jimmie L Bounds in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 8/26/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40.

Defendant Jimmie L Bounds in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed. To be addressed on next court date.

Defendant Jimmie L Bounds in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Scheduling Conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned or Scheduling to branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jimmie L Bounds in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jimmie L Bounds in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
